docs.title: Math Example
docs.text:
Here's an example of an inline equation: E = mc^2 .

And a display equation:

E = mc^2

docs.title: Python Code Example
docs.text:
Here's a simple example of Python code that calculates the factorial of a number:

def factorial(n):
    """Calculate the factorial of a number using recursion."""
    if n == 0:
        return 1
    else:
        return n * factorial(n-1)

# Example usage
number = 5
print(f"The factorial of {number} is {factorial(number)}")

The output of this code will be:

The factorial of 5 is 120

docs.title: Inline Code Example
docs.text: You can also highlight inline code like this: print("Hello, World!").

docs.title: Code Annotation Example
docs.text:
Here's an example with code annotation:

def greet(name):
    # This function greets the person whose name is passed as a parameter
    return f"Hello, {name}!"

# Example usage
print(greet("Alice"))  # Outputs: Hello, Alice!

docs.title: Code Copy Button Example
docs.text: You can easily copy the code block above by clicking the copy button on the top right corner of the code block.

docs.title: Snippet Example
docs.text:
You can include external code snippets with the pymdownx.snippets extension. Here's an example of including a snippet:

!!! include "path/to/snippet.py"

Ensure you have the file snippet.py in the specified path for this to work.

docs.title: Admonition Example
docs.text:
Note

This is an admonition note example. You can use it to highlight important information.
